org.safs.tools.drivers

Class DriverConfiguredSTAFInterfaceClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.tools.drivers.DriverConfiguredSTAFInterfaceClass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurableToolsInterface, GenericToolsInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericEngine, SAFSINPUT, SAFSLOGS, SAFSMAPS, SAFSVARS, STAFLocalServer

    public abstract class DriverConfiguredSTAFInterfaceClass
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConfigurableToolsInterface
    Provides a generic, incomplete implementation of a ConfigurableToolsInterface that requires or expects a DriverInterface as the object used to access configuration information.

    It provides the generic tasks of registering with STAF using the Driver's name as the process name needed by STAF. It does this through the STAFProcessHelpers class so that all associated tools in the process can use the same process name.

    Any attempt to launchInterface through this class will also trigger the verification that STAF is running. If it is not, the instance will attempt to launch STAF automatically. Configuration information can be provided via the ConfigureInterface as shown below. Default values will be used if not provided. 

     [STAF]
 PATH=Full path to/STAFProc     (or bat, script, etc.)
 CONFIG=Full path to/yourCustom.CFG
 EMBEDSEM=TRUE

    The provided finalizer will unRegister the instance with the STAFProcessHelpers class to retain proper reference counts in STAFProcessHelpers.

      • weStartedSTAF

        protected static boolean weStartedSTAF
        Flag to record whether this JVM (DRIVER) started STAF. If we started STAF, we then may be allowed to shut it down.

      • machine

        protected java.lang.String machine
        The "where" of our associated STAF service for this instance. By default, the are on the "local" machine.

      • launchCount

        protected long launchCount
        Tracking how many launchInterface calls processed.

      • shutdownCount

        protected long shutdownCount
        Track how many things must be shutdown before we can attempt to shutdown STAF. We will only attempt to shutdown STAF if weStartedSTAF= true

      • setLogUtilities

        public void setLogUtilities(LogUtilities log)
        If the driver can't be set, the log must be set for logging messages. This method is used for setup the LogUtilities. In the org.safs.rational.DCDriverCommand (a Processor), we create a new engine org.safs.tools.engines.TIDDriverCommand, but we don't have the driver to initialize a new engine, so we just set the LogUtilizes to keep the log working.
        Parameters:
        log -

      • setLogUtilities

                   boolean copyLogClass)
        This method is used to setup the LogUtilities and OPTIONALLY setup to copyLogClass.
        Parameters:
        log -
        copyLogClass - set to true to copy everything to the debug log (Log.class)

      • getSTAFHelper

        public void getSTAFHelper()
        Get our STAFProcessHelper. Launch STAF if it is not running. Will give us our STAFHelper object once everything is running. Tries to create a connection to STAF. If not running, we will attempt to launch STAF with a simple execution of STAFProc.exe and set the static weStartedSTAF flag to TRUE.

        If necessary, or desirable, the configuration source can specify the full path to an executable, and the path to any alternate configuration file desired. STAFProc will use its default configuration file if no other is specified. 

         [STAF]
 PATH=Full path to/STAFProc.EXE (or shell, bat, script, etc.)
 CONFIG=Full path to/yourCustom.CFG
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if we are unable to return TRUE.

      • launchInterface

        public void launchInterface(java.lang.Object configInfo)
        Generic extraction of Driver, Config, and STAFHelper objects. Each concrete subclass must override to provide their own specific interface initialization, but they must call this routine before proceeding with their own launch activities using:

        super.launchInterface(configInfo);

        popuplates the driver, processName, config, and staf fields with valid objects. These items are properly unregistered/destroyed in the finalize() method.

        Specified by:
        launchInterface in interface ConfigurableToolsInterface
        Parameters:
        configInfo - can be whatever the final implementation needs it to be. This might be a String with configuration information, the name of a class, or an instance of some object used to provide configuration assets.
        See Also:
        ConfigurableToolsInterface.launchInterface(Object)

      • getEmbeddedJVMBinPath

        public java.io.File getEmbeddedJVMBinPath()
                                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        See if SAFS has an embedded JVM with it.
        Returns:
        the File object pointing to a valid JVM\bin directory.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if we could not locate an embedded JVM Path.

      • configureJSTAFServiceEmbeddedJVMOption

        public java.lang.String configureJSTAFServiceEmbeddedJVMOption(java.lang.String options)
        Configure SAFS Services to use the embedded 32-bit JVM if:

        • the shared JSTAF JVM is not already running.
        • existing configuration OPTION does not explicitly set a different JVM.
        • SAFS has an embedded JRE (\SAFS\jre\bin\java) exists.
        Parameters:
        options - already retrieved from config files
        Returns:
        options with new JVM= param added, or options unmodified.

      • shutdownService

        protected void shutdownService(java.lang.String aname)
        Provides a default shutdown implementation for services. Subclasses that are not services should override this method to provide the correct shutdown behavior.
        Parameters:
        aname - Generally the servicename or client name used in STAF. Default values passed in are usually the same as the servicename field.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Each concrete subclass may override to provide their own specific interface shutdown.

        This implementation checks to see if weStartedService=true. If so, it will attempt to shutdown the servicename through STAF.

        This implementation will also see if weStartedSTAF=true. If so, then it will attempt to decrement shutdownCount. If shutdownCount reaches 0 then it will attempt to shutdown STAF.

        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface GenericToolsInterface
        See Also:
        GenericToolsInterface#shutdown()

      • isToolRunning

        public boolean isToolRunning()
        Description copied from interface: GenericToolsInterface
        TRUE if the underlying tool is running. Typically called AFTER initialization attempts have been made.
        Specified by:
        isToolRunning in interface GenericToolsInterface
        See Also:
        GenericToolsInterface#isToolRunning()

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        finalize if we are ever destroyed without the JVM shutting down. Most importantly, this unRegisters us through STAFProcessHelpers and reduces the STAFHelpers instance count appropriately.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
